sentences: Sylvester Austin (September 17, 1929 â€“ September 1, 2001) was an American jazz saxophonist.
Austin was born in Dunnellon, Florida, United States, and taught himself to play as a 12-year-old.
He won the Ted Mack Amateur Hour in St. Petersburg, Florida in 1945, playing "Danny Boy".
His performance brought him a recording contract with Mercury Records, and he moved to New York, where he studied for a time at the Juilliard School of Music.
Austin played with Roy Eldridge briefly in 1949, and with Cootie Williams in 1951-52 and Tiny Bradshaw in 1952-54, before setting up his own successful touring group.
Austin described the sound of his 1950s singles to author Wayne Jancik.
"After leaving Mercury in the 1960s, he recorded with a few other labels, including SSS, owned by Shelby Singleton.
He made also a few records in Japan in the 1970s.
He was survived by his wife of 52 years, the Rev. Vernice Austin, two daughters, nine grandchildren, and seven great-grandchildren.

Battle Royal' (1959) - Mercury (with saxophonist Red Prysock)Sil Austin, Red Prysock (tenor sax), Dave Martin (piano), Everett Barksdale, Kenny Burrell (guitar), Milt Hinton (bass), David "Panama" Francis (drums)Soft Plaintive and Moody - Mercury
